decks.notes: The deck focuses on using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield for free. It also utilizes cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck has access to powerful card selection and filtering with cards like Ponder and Brainstorm, while also having additional utility and protection spells like Veil of Summer and Stock Up. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies utilizing Dragon Stompy creatures and artifacts to disrupt opponents' mana bases and quickly close out games. It aims to lock down opponents with cards like Magus of the Moon and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Chrome Mox to ramp up its game plan. The deck also includes removal spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption to clear the way for its creatures to attack. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive threats and disruptive elements.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo, which involves using various tutors and fast mana to stack the top of the library with a winning sequence of cards. Thassa's Oracle is then used to win the game instantly by drawing from an empty library. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and discard spells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game as quickly and efficiently as possible.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo finish. It includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo, as well as cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection. The key strategy revolves around using efficient reanimation spells to cheat creatures into play and overwhelm the opponent with high-powered threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Archon of Cruelty. The deck also includes control elements like Daze and Brazen Borrower to disrupt the opponent's plan while setting up its own combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing Cloudpost ramp to quickly generate mana and play powerful threats such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. It also includes various control elements like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly to play big threats ahead of schedule while maintaining control over the game with disruptive spells. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful threats and control elements, creating a challenging board state for them to deal with.

The deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill the library, triggering Narcomoeba and Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. It utilizes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga to help dig for combo pieces, while also packing disruption with Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares for protection. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on casting powerful creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher quickly by using Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb for ramp. Its aggressive strategy is supported by disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command to control the opponent's board. The deck also includes cards like Wasteland and Glaring Fleshraker to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Simian Spirit Guide help accelerate its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, using cards like Entomb and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield. It also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Wasteland. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower provide additional value and utility, making this deck a versatile and aggressive combo-reanimator archetype.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a quick and aggressive victory. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to outpace the opponent with explosive plays and overwhelming threats, utilizing both reanimation and control elements to create a powerful and versatile game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures using acceleration like Lotus Petal and Eldrazi Temple. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer while overwhelming them with aggressive threats like Glaring Fleshraker and It That Heralds the End. The deck also includes utility lands like Eye of Ugin and Cavern of Souls to support the Eldrazi strategy. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Kozilek's Command provide additional removal and versatility.

The main strategy of this Aggro Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base by playing cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while quickly deploying threats like Broadside Bombardiers, Fury, and Pyrogoyf to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck aims to quickly ramp into powerful plays using cards like Chrome Mox, City of Traitors, and Ancient Tomb, while also utilizing cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Sundering Eruption to deal with threats and maintain board control.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and disruption, utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes efficient spells like Force of Will and Lightning Bolt to interact with the opponent's game plan. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Daze and Brazen Borrower provide additional tempo advantage. The deck aims to quickly close out games by maintaining board presence and leveraging its efficient cards to outpace the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a focus on utilizing Ninjas to deal damage to the opponent quickly and efficiently. By playing cheap creatures like Ornithopter and Changeling Outcast, the deck aims to trigger abilities that allow for additional damage with cards like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. With a mix of counter spells like Force of Will and disruption like Wasteland, the deck aims to control the game while maintaining pressure on the opponent to win before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Cloudpost and Glimmerpost to cast big spells like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. It also includes powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Chalice of the Void to control the board and disrupt opponents. Additionally, Thundertrap Trainer can be used to search for key pieces of the combo. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of ramp, control, and powerful game-ending threats.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock them out of the game using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void. By quickly ramping out powerful threats like Obsidian Charmaw and Broadside Bombardiers, as well as using burn spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption, the deck aims to apply early pressure and close out the game before the opponent can recover. The inclusion of cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide help to accelerate the deck's game plan.

The main concept of this combo deck is to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo using various tools like Dark Ritual, Brainstorm, Ponder, and Personal Tutor, then win the game by resolving Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck aims to be efficient and fast, with ways to draw through the deck and find the combo pieces while controlling the game with counter magic. The mana base includes various fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana needed for the combo.
